alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued June 21 at 5:52AM EDT until June 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING IS CANCELLED FOR THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Warning, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Watch, up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 9 AM EDT this morning, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Warning, from 2 PM this afternoon to 8 PM EDT this evening, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from late tonight through Thursday morning, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 4:36 PM and 4:49 AM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 6:23 PM and 6:15 AM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 5:47 PM and 5:39 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 21/05 AM 3.3 1.7 1.7 1.0 Minor 21/05 PM 3.5 1.9 2.1 2.0 Moderate 22/05 AM 3.5 1.9 2.0 1.0 Moderate 22/06 PM 3.1 1.5 1.7 1.0 Minor 23/06 AM 3.1 1.5 1.6 1.0 Minor 23/06 PM 2.8 1.2 1.4 1.0 None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
